Action.Name: Send Text .. graphs to RPI display

Field.tooltip: select pi- server number and then click on confirm
Field.Label: select Display device:

You can use %%v:VariName%% or %%v:VariID%% or %%v:DeviceName:stateName%% or %%v:DeviceID:stateName%% for any part of text input You can use different options for differnt displays eg regular pixel displays do not offer LED fonts There is a major looop that gets executed xx times (1-inifnity) The screen can be reset to any color before each major loop You can set overall intensity (reduced from 100%) Then there are elements in each loop that can be shown -in sequence (immediate), rolling left right up down of screen replacements after 0-xx secs of delay -or after all elements have been defined (use wait until all .. and immediate for the last element) Elements available are: points, dots, ellipses, lines, triangle, rectangles, histograms, bars w or w/o box, text, images, datestamp and timestamp, digital Day Time full page, analogClock Each element has position, color, reset screen to xx-color before showing some have width and fonts defs Each element can be set to be shown off/on/off in seconds interval. This way you can overlay elements and show them in sequence in a part of the screen The action menu offers 70 elements, you can use python script for more elements- the are presented in a section of ten. You must select the section to edit them enable debug output devices and copy the example script and expand in indigo action script
One time function exuted before elements....
reset display start; to do nothing:bl, off:0, on:255:
enable / disable scrolling for this action(not for TFT display)
Start: delay by secs or set Date YYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS when to start:
Edit elements .. first select window of elements (group of 10)
.. after set of elements is finished do --save Window data--
Delay above command by xx seconds:
bf display do nothing:"", blank:0, on:255:
